item.title: Blocked Drains, 1st December
item.description:
Multiple blocked drains on the left hand side along the A40 as you drive up the hill after the traffic light junction with A436 this is all the way up to the dual carriageway section with some drains on the dual carriage also appearing clogged. Preventing water draining away leading to excessive spray in wet and rainy conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drains, 1st December
item.description:
Multiple block drains in various locations as you drive up the hill. Road is like a river in heavy rain as the water is not flowing into the drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No bin = lots of dog poo bags, 1st December
item.description:
End of Dowswell reservoir opposite the lower dowswell junction … there is no bin and an accumulation of dog poo bags and other waste. Can I please request a bin gets put in here asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold

item.title: Dropped kerb dangerous, 1st December
item.description:
The dropped kerb outside 101 Dinglewell is very unsafe and rocky. My elderly grandparents live here and I’m worried for their safety. My grandad is living with Alzheimer’s and is registered blind so this needs to be fixed promptly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscroft Road, Gloucester

item.title: Rocky dropped kerb, 1st December
item.description:
The dropped kerb outside 101 Dinglewell is very rocky and needs to be bedded back in. My elderly parents live at this address and this is a welfare issue as my father is blind and has dementia. This has been an issue well over a year and has been reported, but nothing has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All drains either blocked or not adequately draining - large pools of water causing drenched pedestrians, 1st December
item.description:
Both sides of the pedestrian crossing have inadequate drainage meaning water pools for a long time. This affects both sides of the road by the pedestrian crossing as well as outside the entrance to the vets. I have seen cars / lorries drench multiple pedestrians including school children and older adults.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement floods regularly, 1st December
item.description:
Next to the traffic island on the Providence Park side of the road, pavement completely floods every time it rains. There is no drain here, so the water remains for days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46-61, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights are failing, 1st December
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights on lobleys drive and Lobleys road in Brockworth are failing. The main traffic lights at the crossroads at a Gambet rd are also failing because of backed up traffic and people having skipped lights. Lights are only remaining on for up to 5 seconds and that’s it. There is backed up traffic in all directions
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambet Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Builders’ waste in front of the garage block, on the highway and pavement/service strip, restricting access to garages and communal parking area. Periodically waste is partially removed but never completely, and has been an issue since the first full week of September this year. Reporting it now as wet and windy conditions over the past few days have resulted in several items being blown across the cul de sac and the soil turning into a ‘river’ of mud on the road and inconveniencing other residents. The waste is not covered and at night there are no lights suggesting that this use of the highway is not licensed., 1st December
item.description:
In front of garage block opposite Bramble Cottage, 9 Gwinnett Court, Shurdington GL51 4GQ

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Gwinnett Court, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
